body:
@TonyBagnall installing `fbprophet` on windows is a bit tricky, I decided to use miniconda to get it running. Can you try the following in sequence:

```
pip uninstall -y pystan fbprophet
conda install libpython m2w64-toolchain -c msys2
pip install pystan
pip install fbprophet
```
So generally, this issue is not directly related to `sktime`.

issue.title: [BUG] sktime Installation fails on Windows 10 due to OpenMP error

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When following the steps from https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/installation.html#windows, the installer complains that the folder /openmp is not accessible and quits.

Currently, I have 

**To Reproduce**

1. Follow steps one thru six of the attached documentation link.
2. Before running pip install --verbose, run `conda install fbprophet`. If  I don't do this, I get weird errors related to sklearn not being installed, although it is
3. Face the issue.


**Expected behavior**
Installation of sktime and allowing to run the tests. This works fine using WSL2 on the same machine.

**Additional context**
Disabling usage of openmp with the SKTIME_NO_OPENMP flag does allow the installation to take place, but when running tests, a whole slew of issues arise with numpy during test case collection.

**Versions**
<details>
System:
    python: 3.8.6 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Jan 25 2021, 22:54:47) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
executable: C:\Users\Luis\anaconda3\envs\sktime2\python.exe
   machine: Windows-10-10.0.18362-SP0

Python dependencies:
          pip: 20.2.4
   setuptools: 49.6.0.post20210108
      sklearn: 0.23.2
       sktime: 0.5.3
  statsmodels: 0.12.2
        numpy: 1.20.1
        scipy: 1.6.0
       Cython: 0.29.17
       pandas: 1.1.5
   matplotlib: 3.3.4
       joblib: 1.0.1
        numba: 0.52.0
     pmdarima: 1.8.0
      tsfresh: 0.17.0
</details>

body: @aiwalter I'm currently running on a Mac machine. We tested Pystan: it seems Pystan 2.19 is installed correctly. Doesn't look like I should be getting any issues as I followed all the previous build steps and it works till I run pytest sktime/ This is the error I'm getting: Stored in a gist: https://gist.github.com/kanand77/b3e33f4ac62aa15480d2b1a33775deac

@luiszugasti I have two other options you might try:

1) Above solution but with this instead:
`pip install pystan --no-cache`

2) Installation via conda:
```
conda install -c conda-forge pystan
conda install -c conda-forge fbprophet
````
Btw I am using Python 3.7.
@koralturkk maybe you can support here regarding above problem on Mac or at least write how you did installation of `fbprophet`?

issue.title: Troubles getting prophet to work in Python

repository.name: prophet
repository.description: Tool for producing high quality forecasts for time series data that has multiple seasonality with linear or non-linear growth.

issue.body:
I've installed using conda following the directions. I'm simply trying to run the example given at https://facebook.github.io/prophet/docs/quick_start.html#python-api to verify everything is working. As soon as I run the m.fit(df) command, I get the error

INFO:numexpr.utils:NumExpr defaulting to 4 threads.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
KeyError                                  Traceback (most recent call last)
KeyError: 'metric_file'


and the kernel blows up. Any guidance appreciated.

issue.title: Prophet version

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
Changed `fbprophet` to `prophet` as this is the new Python package with a new release.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
`prophet`
